intro.description:
This cheat sheet will demonstrate how to extend the Eclipse Browser view by adding a custom extesion using PDE.
To learn more about using cheat sheets, click the help button in the top right corner (?).

item.title: Create a new plug-in
item.description: To create the plug-in, perform the following steps:

subitem.label: Select "File->New->Project..." from the main menu to bring up the "New Project" wizard. Expand the "Plug-in Development" category, choose "Plug-in Project" and press "Next".
Input "org.eclipse.browser.extension" into the "Project Name" text box. Accept all defaults and press "Next".
Accept all default values on the "Plug-in Content" page and press "Finish". A new plug-in project will be created and the plug-in manifest editor will open automatically.

item.title: Define a new link
item.description: To contribute a new link to the Eclipse Browser view, perform the following steps:

subitem.label: On the "Extensions" page of the plug-in manifest editor, press the "Add..." button in the "All Extensions" section to open the "New Extension" wizard.
Deselect the checkbox labeled "Show only extension points from the required plug-ins".
Select "org.eclipse.browser.usefulLinks" from the "Extension Points" list box and press "Finish".
Select "No" when prompted "Do you want to add plug-in org.eclipsecon.browser, declaring the usefulLinks extension point, to the list of plug-in dependencies?".

item.title: Add new link object
item.description: To add an additional link object, perform the following steps:

subitem.label: Right-click the "org.eclipse.browser.usefulLinks" in the list box under "All Extensions" heading in the "Extensions" page and select "New->linkObject" from the context menu.
Replace the content of the "name" text box under "Extension Element Details" with "Eclipse Articles".
Replace the content of the "link" text box with "http://www.eclipse.org/articles/".
Right-click on the "linkObject" element and select "New>description" from the context menu.
Select the "description" element. Expand the "Body Text" section at the bottom of the "Extensions" page and input "Web site to find Eclipse-related articles" in the text area.

item.title: Test the plug-in
item.description: To test your plug-in, perform the following steps:

subitem.label: On the "Overview" of the plug-in manifest editor, click the "Launch an Eclipse application" hyperlink under the "Testing" heading to launch a second instance of Eclipse.
Note the "Eclipse Articles" link under the "Useful Links" section in the Eclipse Browser view. Click on it to view the associated web site in an embedded browser.
Select "File->Exit" from the main menu to close the second Eclipse instance.
